info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 09 at 2:01PM MDT until May 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning Today, Fire Weather Watch Tuesday and Wednesday... A Red Flag Warning for critical fire weather conditions remains in effect today south of a line from Kit Carson county Colorado to Gove county Kansas. Counties not in the warning. Fire Weather Watches are in effect for the far southwestern and western portions of the forecast area on Tuesday and Wednesday. Outdoor burning is highly discouraged across the highlighted counties across Colorado and Kansas over the next few days. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 252... ...RED FLAG WARNING IS CANCELLED FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 252... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. The Red Flag Warning has been cancelled. * Affected Area...In Colorado...Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma. * Winds...Southeast 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 13 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
